management_items.title: Costco’s AI, tech use helps offset healthcare costs, CFO says
management_items.summary: CEO Ron Vachris highlights how pre‑scan technology speeds checkout by up to 20%, and AI is used to compare prescription drug pricing and autonomously reorder inventory, improving in‑stock rates.
key_quotes: In the warehouse implementation of scanning memberships at entry, the Costco Digital Wallet and pre‑scanning small‑ to medium‑sized baskets is leading to better member experience and improved productivity.
This is not “technology for technology’s sake” but rather that the club retailer is using tech to improve its operational efficiency.
management_items.relevance_reason: Demonstrates Costco’s commitment to AI‑driven operational efficiency and customer experience—key areas where Presti’s AI‑generated visuals could integrate into digital workflows.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a tool that enhances digital workflows and operational efficiency.
Highlight how AI‑generated imagery can integrate into automated systems like digital wallets or pre‑scan interfaces.
Emphasize efficiency gains and member experience improvements via visual automation.

management_items.title: Costco ecommerce sales growth tops 20% in Q1
management_items.summary: CEO Ron Vachris outlines Costco’s digital vision to make shopping easier, faster, and more personal, citing digital wallet, pre‑scanning baskets, AI in pharmacy, personalization, and strong ecommerce growth of 20.5% in Q1 FY2026.
key_quotes: We aim to make the shopping at Costco easier, faster and more personal, no matter where or how our members choose to shop.

This isn’t about technology for technology’s sake. It’s about using technology to strengthen the fundamentals that makes Costco who we are, increasing member loyalty, driving top‑line sales and improving efficiency in our operations so that we can bring goods to market at the lowest possible price.
management_items.relevance_reason: Clear articulation of digital personalization and AI‑driven member experience—ideal entry point for Presti’s AI‑based visual content to support personalization and digital engagement.
sales_insights: Frame Presti as enhancing personalization in ecommerce visuals.
Emphasize how AI imagery supports loyalty and member engagement.
Tie Presti’s capabilities to Costco’s goal of making shopping faster and more personal.

management_items.title: Costco digital transformation drives e‑commerce growth and customer experience
management_items.summary: Costco reports 16.1% ecommerce growth in 2024, driven by digital transformation. Senior management includes Javier PolitExecutive (CIDO), Terry Williams (SVP IT), and Mike Parrott (SVP Ecommerce). Logistics deliveries up 29%, especially in appliances, furniture, and bulky items.
management_items.relevance_reason: Identifies key digital leadership roles and highlights growth in furniture and bulky items—directly relevant to Presti’s focus on home & furniture imagery.
sales_insights: Target Javier PolitExecutive or SVP Ecommerce as digital transformation leaders.
Emphasize Presti’s ability to scale lifestyle imagery for bulky furniture categories.
Leverage logistics growth to argue for visual content supporting online furniture sales.

management_items.title: Costco CFO: New Tech, Expanding Online Buying‑Pickup on Way
management_items.summary: CFO Gary Millerchip discusses technological improvements including expanded buy‑online‑pickup‑in‑warehouse, adding larger electronics to store shelves, and increased focus on retail media and data programs.
key_quotes: We are working on all those aspects right now. We’re rolling out an expanded buy‑online‑pickup‑in‑warehouse.

Technology is going to be one of our key priorities moving forward … You know, we see a great opportunity for data. We have expanded our group there. We have a significant program now with retail media.
management_items.relevance_reason: Shows CFO’s focus on omnichannel and retail media—Presti’s imagery could support buy‑online‑pickup experiences and retail media campaigns.
sales_insights: Propose Presti visuals for buy‑online‑pickup product displays.
Highlight how AI imagery can enhance retail media effectiveness.
Position Presti as a data‑driven visual partner aligned with CFO’s priorities.

management_items.title: Costco ecommerce sales rise 18.9% in fiscal Q4
management_items.summary: CEO Ron Vachris reports 18.9% ecommerce growth in Q4 FY2024, driven by improved assortment, delivery times, app downloads, search upgrades, and buy‑online‑pickup‑in‑warehouse for TVs and laptops.
key_quotes: We have great momentum with this business and expect big and bulky items will be a key part of our continued progress with ecommerce in the coming year.
management_items.relevance_reason: Emphasizes growth in big & bulky categories (furniture/appliances) and digital enhancements—ideal for Presti’s lifestyle imagery targeting.
sales_insights: Pitch Presti for big & bulky product imagery to support ecommerce growth.
Tie into app and search improvements with optimized visuals.
Leverage pickup channel to showcase lifestyle visuals in-store and online.

management_items.title: Costco Makes a Game‑Changing Shift into the Digital Era with New CEO Ron Vachris and CFO Gary Millerchip
management_items.summary: Under new CEO Ron Vachris, Costco is accelerating digital integration, rolling out expanded buy‑online‑pickup‑in‑warehouse, and investing in retail media and data programs, while maintaining value pricing like the $1.50 hot dog.
key_quotes: We are working on all those aspects right now. We’re rolling out an expanded buy online, pick up in warehouse.
Technology is going to be one of our key priorities moving forward.
management_items.relevance_reason: Reinforces CEO’s digital acceleration and retail media focus—Presti can support omnichannel visual needs while preserving value messaging.
sales_insights: Frame Presti as enabling digital acceleration with cost‑effective imagery.
Highlight alignment with retail media and omnichannel strategies.
Emphasize support for value messaging through consistent visuals.

management_items.title: Costco’s exclusive hours for executive members ‘very well received,’ drive sales boost of 1%
management_items.summary: CEO Ron Vachris says exclusive early hours for Executive members and Instacart credits drove a 1% weekly U.S. sales boost and increased upgrades to Executive membership.
key_quotes: We estimate these incremental hours have added about 1% to weekly US sales since implementation.
management_items.relevance_reason: Highlights membership experience enhancements and sales lift—Presti could support marketing of these perks with compelling visuals.
sales_insights: Offer Presti imagery to promote Executive member perks.
Use visuals to support campaigns around membership upgrades.
Tie lifestyle visuals to exclusive shopping experiences.

management_items.title: Costco (COST) Q4 2025: Executive Membership Upgrades Drive 9% Growth, Fueling Share Gains
management_items.summary: CFO Gary Millerchip notes executive members represent nearly half of paid memberships and over 70% of sales. Digital‑enabled sales topped $27B, with ecommerce up 15% and strong logistics and retail media performance.
key_quotes: Executive members now represent nearly half of paid memberships and over 70% of sales.
management_items.relevance_reason: Shows the financial impact of digital and membership tiers—Presti visuals could support high‑value member communications and digital sales channels.
sales_insights: Target campaigns to Executive members with premium visuals.
Position Presti imagery as enhancing digital sales for high‑value segments.
Leverage retail media opportunities with compelling visuals.

management_items.title: Costco ecommerce sales grow 13.6% in Q4, 15.6% in fiscal 2025
management_items.summary: CFO Gary Millerchip reports ecommerce sales of $19.6B in FY2025 (+15.6%), with improvements in search, password‑less sign‑in, waiting rooms for high‑velocity items, and retail media delivering strong ROI.
key_quotes: We continue to make progress with our technology roadmap for digital and ecommerce.
management_items.relevance_reason: Highlights digital enhancements and retail media success—Presti can support search, personalization, and media campaigns with scalable imagery.
sales_insights: Propose Presti visuals for search and personalization features.
Emphasize imagery’s role in retail media ROI.
Align Presti with Costco’s technology roadmap for ecommerce.

management_items.title: Costco Expands IT Capabilities to Meet Rising Digital Demand
management_items.summary: CEO Ron Vachris describes progress on Costco’s technology roadmap: pre‑scanning baskets, improved search, password‑less login, virtual waiting rooms, personalization, and retail media built on unified member data.
key_quotes: This is speeding up the checkout process.
We continue to make progress with our technology roadmap for digital and e‑commerce.
management_items.relevance_reason: Detailed technology roadmap with personalization and retail media—Presti’s AI imagery can plug into these digital enhancements and personalization strategies.
sales_insights: Position Presti as part of the technology roadmap for personalization.
Suggest integration of AI visuals into checkout and retail media flows.
Highlight speed and efficiency gains from automated imagery.

key_executives_identified.name: Ron Vachris
key_executives_identified.title: Chief Executive Officer
key_executives_identified.relevance: Primary decision‑maker driving digital vision, personalization, AI, and ecommerce growth—key for Presti’s value proposition.

key_executives_identified.name: Gary Millerchip
key_executives_identified.title: Chief Financial Officer
key_executives_identified.relevance: Leading ecommerce, retail media, omnichannel pickup, and membership economics—critical for ROI‑focused sales messaging.

key_executives_identified.name: Javier PolitExecutive
key_executives_identified.title: Chief Information & Digital Officer
key_executives_identified.relevance: Digital transformation leader overseeing ecommerce, logistics, and IT—strategic for technical integration of Presti.

overall_assessment.decision_maker_visibility: high - Costco’s CEO and CFO are highly visible in public earnings calls and media, articulating digital and ecommerce strategy.
strategic_priorities: Accelerating digital and ecommerce growth via AI and personalization
Enhancing operational efficiency and checkout experience through technology
Expanding retail media and omnichannel capabilities tied to membership tiers
presti_entry_points: AI‑generated lifestyle visuals to enhance personalization and search
Scalable imagery for big & bulky product categories in ecommerce and pickup
Visual content to support retail media campaigns and membership upgrade messaging
overall_assessment.recommended_contact: Target CEO Ron Vachris first—he is the public champion of digital transformation and personalization. His strategic vision aligns closely with Presti’s AI‑driven visual capabilities and can open doors to CFO Gary Millerchip and CIDO Javier PolitExecutive for technical and ROI discussions.

management_items.title: Target Announces Strategic Plans to Drive More Than $15 Billion in Sales Growth by 2030
management_items.summary: Brian Cornell outlines Target’s multi‑channel strategy to drive $15B in sales growth by 2030, focusing on trend‑forward assortments, digital‑physical integration, AI personalization, marketplace expansion, and supply‑chain speed and reliability.
key_quotes: Shoppers continue to seek differentiated options and distinctive shopping experiences without sacrificing value, and Target has the scale, strategy and capabilities to support all the ways consumers shop and engage with brands.
Our strategy is all about creating today's Tarzhay, offering everyday discovery and delight for millions of families and ensuring Target is a consumer favorite for years to come.
management_items.relevance_reason: Direct strategic priorities align with Presti’s value in scalable visual content, digital experience, and speed-to-market.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a partner to accelerate trend‑forward home assortment imagery.
Emphasize Presti’s ability to support AI‑driven personalization with scalable image generation.
Highlight how Presti can enhance marketplace product discovery and digital content efficiency.

management_items.title: Get to Know Lisa Roath, Target's New Chief Marketing Officer
management_items.summary: Lisa Roath, newly appointed CMO, emphasizes marketing’s role in delivering inspiration, connection, and joy, and shares her focus on simplifying complex ideas into three priorities: value, ease, and differentiation.
key_quotes: Marketing is such a core component of how we relate to our guests, and in many ways, we’re just getting started in connecting people with the affordable joy that defines our shopping experience.
We distilled our list to three priorities: value, ease and differentiation.
management_items.relevance_reason: CMO’s focus on differentiation and ease aligns with Presti’s ability to deliver compelling lifestyle imagery that simplifies marketing execution.
sales_insights: Pitch Presti as a tool to deliver differentiated visual storytelling with ease.
Frame Presti’s imagery as supporting marketing’s value‑ease‑differentiation pillars.
Offer pilot to demonstrate speed and simplicity in content creation.

management_items.title: Target CEO (and Head “Coach”) Brian Cornell Focuses On Retail Fundamentals
management_items.summary: Cornell emphasizes the importance of retail fundamentals—reliability, availability, and guest experience—drawing parallels to sports coaching and highlighting in‑person mentorship and trust building.
key_quotes: When we think about retail fundamentals, we focus on making sure that we're reliable, which in our business is code for the promise that when you shop, either online or in our store, what you're shopping for is going to be available.
Eight times a year, he takes a big handful of his officers on a two‑day, “accelerated mentorship program” … spend time in Target stores and distribution centers.
management_items.relevance_reason: Focus on reliability and availability underscores the need for consistent, high‑quality visual content across channels—an area Presti can support.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a reliable content partner ensuring consistent imagery availability.
Highlight Presti’s scalability to support omnichannel consistency.
Suggest executive‑level pilot tied to store‑level merchandising reliability.

management_items.title: Target’s CEO brought his top 50 leaders together. Here’s the advice he gave them
management_items.summary: At a leadership meeting, Cornell emphasized understanding the 'why' behind decisions and investments, stressing culture and purpose over just actions.
key_quotes: We spent a lot of time making sure we understood the why—why do we make certain decisions? Why do we make certain investments? Why is culture so important?
management_items.relevance_reason: Understanding the 'why' provides a way to align Presti’s value proposition with Target’s cultural and strategic intent.
sales_insights: Frame Presti’s solution in terms of why it matters—guest delight, brand culture, innovation.
Use storytelling that aligns with Target’s purpose‑driven culture.
Propose a pilot that ties to cultural impact, not just ROI.

management_items.title: New Target CEO Michael Fiddelke faces challenges
management_items.summary: Fiddelke acknowledges slumping sales and customer loyalty, and outlines his top priorities: restoring merchant reputation, enhancing in‑store experience, and leveraging technology to improve operations.
key_quotes: I know we're not realizing our full potential right now, and so I'm stepping into the role with a clear and urgent commitment to build new momentum in the business and get back to profitable growth.
He pledged to move with urgency to get the company back to sales growth.
management_items.relevance_reason: Incoming CEO’s focus on tech‑enabled customer experience and momentum aligns with Presti’s capabilities in accelerating visual content and digital merchandising.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a fast, tech‑driven lever to improve customer experience.
Emphasize speed and momentum in content creation to support turnaround.
Offer a pilot focused on improving in‑store and online visual experience.

management_items.title: All About Target’s Next CEO, Michael Fiddelke
management_items.summary: Target introduces Fiddelke, highlighting his leadership across operations, supply chain, digital capabilities, and his belief in design‑led innovation and simplifying work to accelerate performance.
key_quotes: We’re a design‑led company that wins by pairing incredible product with an incredible experience, and my confidence in our team and my belief that Target’s best days are ahead of us could not be higher.
management_items.relevance_reason: Fiddelke’s design‑led and simplification focus aligns with Presti’s ability to streamline visual content creation and enhance product experience.
sales_insights: Highlight Presti’s design‑led imagery generation as aligned with his vision.
Emphasize simplification of content workflows.
Propose a pilot that accelerates performance via streamlined visual production.

management_items.title: Target CEO Brian Cornell weighs in on price gouging
management_items.summary: Cornell rejects price‑gouging accusations, noting retail’s slim margins and competitive pricing, and emphasizes customer responsiveness and affordability.
key_quotes: We're in a penny business.
Retailers have to be responsive to customers or risk losing business.
management_items.relevance_reason: Emphasis on affordability and responsiveness suggests Presti’s cost‑efficient imagery could support value messaging.
sales_insights: Position Presti as cost‑effective content solution supporting affordability narrative.
Highlight ability to quickly respond to pricing or promotional shifts with updated visuals.
Offer rapid imagery updates tied to pricing campaigns.

management_items.title: Al Sharpton calls meeting with Target's CEO amid DEI backlash 'very constructive and candid'
management_items.summary: Cornell met with Rev. Al Sharpton amid backlash over Target scaling back DEI initiatives; the meeting was described as 'very constructive and candid' as Target navigates reputational challenges.
key_quotes: Sharpton called the meeting with Target CEO Brian Cornell 'very constructive and candid.'
management_items.relevance_reason: Shows leadership engagement in sensitive brand issues—Presti could support inclusive imagery strategies to rebuild trust.
sales_insights: Offer Presti’s imagery to support inclusive, sensitive visual storytelling.
Position as a partner in rebuilding brand trust through thoughtful content.
Suggest pilot for inclusive home imagery campaigns.

key_executives_identified.name: Brian Cornell
key_executives_identified.title: Chair and Chief Executive Officer
key_executives_identified.relevance: Primary strategic voice shaping Target’s omnichannel, assortment, and brand culture priorities.

key_executives_identified.name: Lisa Roath
key_executives_identified.title: Chief Marketing Officer
key_executives_identified.relevance: Leads marketing strategy focused on value, ease, and differentiation—key for visual content alignment.

key_executives_identified.name: Michael Fiddelke
key_executives_identified.title: Incoming Chief Executive Officer (then COO)
key_executives_identified.relevance: New CEO focused on turnaround, technology, design‑led innovation and simplification—strong alignment with Presti’s value.

strategic_priorities: Omnichannel growth via digital‑physical integration and AI personalization
Assortment innovation and trend‑forward product speed to market
Turnaround via customer experience, technology, and design‑led simplification
presti_entry_points: Accelerate trend‑forward home imagery to support assortment innovation
Enable scalable, AI‑ready visuals for omnichannel personalization
Simplify content workflows to support turnaround and design‑led experience
overall_assessment.recommended_contact: Begin with Lisa Roath, CMO—her focus on value, ease, and differentiation aligns directly with Presti’s strengths in simplifying and differentiating visual content. A pilot with marketing can demonstrate quick wins and build internal momentum.

management_items.title: Tech Talks Business Features Ted Decker and Fahim Siddiqui of The Home Depot
management_items.summary: Ted Decker and Fahim Siddiqui discuss Home Depot’s culture, technology innovation, and the seamless integration of online and in-store experiences, including AI-driven search and supply chain efficiencies.
key_quotes: Retail has changed more in the last 3 years than it has in the last 30 years… we aggressively designed strategies to go after our own business.
Currently, the company is the fifth largest online e‑commerce business in the U.S., with 60 percent of The Home Depot's transactions starting online.
As more customers search online, they look for solutions rather than simply searching for products.
management_items.relevance_reason: Highlights Home Depot’s focus on AI-powered search and seamless visual customer journeys—directly relevant to Presti’s lifestyle imagery solution.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a way to enhance solution-oriented visual search experiences.
Emphasize scale: support high-volume, online-first transactions.
Tie into omnichannel strategy by bridging in-store and digital visual consistency.

management_items.title: A conversation with Fahim Siddiqui, EVP and CIO at Home Depot
management_items.executive_title: Executive Vice President and Chief Information Officer
management_items.summary: Fahim Siddiqui outlines Home Depot’s digital transformation vision, including leveraging cloud-based engineering, agile development, and innovation across marketing, merchandising, data, analytics, and supply chain.
key_quotes: They cover a lot of ground, to include Home Depot's vision for digital transformation, Generative AI…
Using an agile approach and the latest in cloud-based engineering practices, they enhance the interconnected experience across the company for customers and associates.
management_items.relevance_reason: Direct insight into Home Depot’s use of generative AI and cloud infrastructure—key enablers for Presti’s AI imagery solution.
sales_insights: Frame Presti as a generative AI partner aligned with their digital transformation.
Highlight cloud-native deployment and agile integration.
Position Presti as enhancing merchandising and marketing with scalable AI-generated visuals.

management_items.title: Home Depot elevates CIO from within as AI adoption plans progress
management_items.executive_title: Executive Vice President and Chief Information Officer
management_items.summary: Angie Brown is appointed EVP and CIO, leading technology strategy and AI adoption. Home Depot has piloted over 175 machine learning and generative AI use cases, including in-store productivity tools and cloud-based AI capabilities.
key_quotes: Her strategic vision and deep expertise have been instrumental in transforming Home Depot's interconnected experience, making home improvement more modern, more seamless and more convenient.
By mid‑2024, Home Depot was piloting more than 175 machine learning and generative AI use cases.
management_items.relevance_reason: Demonstrates Home Depot’s aggressive generative AI experimentation—Presti can align with their AI roadmap and offer visual content use cases.
sales_insights: Pitch Presti as a mature generative AI partner ready for rapid deployment.
Offer pilot programs to integrate Presti’s imagery into existing AI use cases.
Emphasize modernization and convenience in visual content workflows.

management_items.title: Home Depot builds a revised growth strategy
management_items.summary: Ted Decker announces Jordan Boggi’s elevation to EVP of Customer Experience and President of Online, emphasizing data-driven innovation to remove friction across digital and physical channels, alongside the strategic acquisition of SRS Distribution to expand market reach.
key_quotes: In his role as president of our online business, [Boggi] brought data‑driven innovation and value to the millions of customers and suppliers who use our website and mobile app.
We continue to remove friction from our customers’ interconnected experience.
management_items.relevance_reason: Focus on frictionless customer journeys and digital innovation aligns with Presti’s ability to streamline visual content creation at scale.
sales_insights: Target Jordan Boggi with messaging around reducing visual content friction.
Highlight how Presti supports seamless customer experience across channels.
Tie into e‑commerce growth and acquisition-driven expansion.

management_items.title: Home Depot Names Jordan Broggi Executive Vice Pres of Customer Experience and Pres of Online
management_items.executive_title: Executive Vice President of Customer Experience and President of Online
management_items.summary: Jordan Broggi is appointed to oversee online operations and customer experience, focusing on digital strategy, online shopping platforms, and customer-centric innovation.
key_quotes: He will oversee the company's online business operations and initiatives to enhance customer experience.
management_items.relevance_reason: Broggi’s role in digital CX and online operations makes him a key target for Presti’s visual content solution.
sales_insights: Approach Broggi with value proposition around enhancing online visual merchandising.
Emphasize customer-centric imagery that scales with online operations.
Offer pilot visuals for mobile and web platforms.

management_items.title: CEO Craig Menear Talks Innovation: Follow the Consumer
management_items.source: The Aspen Institute / Home Depot corporate
management_items.summary: Craig Menear emphasizes rapid retail change, the importance of innovation, and consumer-centric strategy. He describes internal 'war games' to anticipate disruptors and foster entrepreneurial spirit.
key_quotes: Retail has changed more in the last 3 years than it has in the last 30 years… we aggressively designed strategies to go after our own business.
Our leadership team did a ‘war games’ exercise… it really lit a fire under our value of creating an entrepreneurial spirit throughout our company.
management_items.relevance_reason: Highlights Home Depot’s proactive innovation culture—Presti can position itself as a disruptive visual content partner.
sales_insights: Frame Presti as an entrepreneurial, disruptive solution aligned with their innovation mindset.
Suggest war‑game style pilot to demonstrate Presti’s impact.
Emphasize speed and agility in visual content generation.

management_items.title: Watch CNBC's full interview with The Home Depot CEO Ted Decker
management_items.summary: Ted Decker discusses Home Depot’s earnings, raised outlook, and strategic focus areas during a CNBC 'Squawk Box' interview.
key_quotes: Watch CNBC's full interview with The Home Depot CEO Ted Decker.
management_items.relevance_reason: Provides high-level strategic context and CEO visibility, though less focused on visual or digital specifics.
sales_insights: Use CEO-level messaging to align Presti with financial and strategic growth.
Position Presti as supporting improved margins via scalable imagery.

management_items.title: Home Depot CEO: We are looking for housing to unlock
management_items.summary: In this CNBC segment, Ted Decker mentions Home Depot’s strategic interest in unlocking housing opportunities as part of broader growth initiatives.
key_quotes: We are looking for housing to unlock.
management_items.relevance_reason: Signals strategic growth areas but less directly tied to digital or visual content needs.
sales_insights: Position Presti as supporting visual content for housing-related product lines.
Align with growth in housing segments needing scalable imagery.

Seamless omnichannel integration and reducing friction in customer journeys
Innovation culture and entrepreneurial agility to preempt disruptors

management_items.title: Lowe's CEO explains why the company is partnering with Big Tech
management_items.summary: Marvin Ellison discusses Lowe’s partnerships with Apple and Nvidia to deploy AI across sourcing, inventory planning, pricing, and a Vision Pro visualization tool to enhance customer experience.
key_quotes: "We’ve had great work with Nvidia on AI and AI technology that we’re using within our stores… we have used it for… sourcing logic, inventory planning, pricing."
Lowe’s developed a product for Apple’s Vision Pro that aims to make it easier for customers to visualize their home improvement projects.
management_items.relevance_reason: Highlights Lowe’s investment in AI-powered visualization—directly relevant to Presti’s lifestyle image generation solution.
sales_insights: Position Presti as a complementary AI visualization partner to Vision Pro initiatives.
Emphasize how Presti can enhance sourcing logic and pricing visuals.
Frame Presti as enabling scalable lifestyle imagery aligned with Lowe’s AI roadmap.

management_items.title: How Lowe’s is trying to spruce up shopping with AI, mixed‑reality headsets, and other new technologies
management_items.executive_title: Chief Digital and Information Officer & Executive Vice President
management_items.summary: Godbole outlines Lowe’s digital overhaul: replacing legacy tech, enhancing mobile and web for DIY vs Pro, deploying AI tools like Dwell Alerts, ChatGPT-like assistants, Style Your Space app, and Vision Pro pilots.
key_quotes: "It was kind of shocking how behind we were from a technology perspective."
"For investments in generative AI, Godbole focuses on three core pillars: “How we shop,” “how we sell,” and “how we work.”"
"One way Lowe’s is making generative AI accessible to customers is with the Style Your Space app…"
management_items.relevance_reason: Directly addresses generative AI for visual customer experiences—highly aligned with Presti’s value proposition.
sales_insights: Pitch Presti’s scalable lifestyle imagery as an extension of the Style Your Space app.
Highlight how Presti can support both DIY and Pro customer segments with tailored visuals.
Position Presti as a tool to accelerate Lowe’s generative AI pillars across 'shop', 'sell', and 'work'.

management_items.title: Lowe’s leans on AI and ecommerce to drive 2026 growth
management_items.summary: Ellison emphasizes embedding generative AI across customer-facing and internal workflows, noting Mylow tools handle nearly 1M questions/month, doubling online conversion and boosting in-store satisfaction by 200 basis points.
key_quotes: "When our customers engage with Mylow online, the conversion rate more than doubles."
"We’re seeing customer satisfaction scores increase 200 basis points."
management_items.relevance_reason: Demonstrates Lowe’s focus on AI to drive conversion and satisfaction—Presti can contribute via enhanced visual content to support these metrics.
sales_insights: Show how Presti’s visuals can further boost conversion rates in digital channels.
Position Presti as enhancing customer satisfaction through richer imagery.
Align Presti with Lowe’s AI-driven ecommerce expansion strategy.

management_items.title: Lowe's rolls out new AI tool to help answer customers' questions in stores
management_items.summary: Godbole announces the Mylow Companion app—an AI tool developed with OpenAI to assist store associates with product questions and advice via voice-to-text on handheld devices.
key_quotes: "Whether associates have been on the job for five weeks or five years, they can be confident they're delivering expert-level advice and assistance."
management_items.relevance_reason: Shows Lowe’s investment in AI to empower associates—Presti’s imagery could support associate-led selling and visualization.
sales_insights: Suggest Presti visuals be integrated into associate tools like Mylow Companion.
Emphasize how lifestyle images can help associates explain products more effectively.
Position Presti as enhancing in-store AI tools with rich visual content.

management_items.title: Lowe's exec Joe Cano: the future of retail is collaborative, data driven, and customer obsessed
management_items.summary: Cano highlights Lowe’s Marketplace Seller Summit, positioning marketplace as a core growth engine, and underscores AI, personalization, and omnichannel innovation as central to Lowe’s digital mission.
key_quotes: "Marketplace isn’t a side initiative, it’s a core growth engine for Lowe’s."
"AI, personalisation, and omnichannel innovation are transforming how we shop, how we sell, and how we serve."
management_items.relevance_reason: Marketplace expansion and personalization align with Presti’s ability to generate tailored lifestyle visuals at scale.
sales_insights: Propose Presti imagery for marketplace listings to enhance personalization.
Frame Presti as a tool to support omnichannel consistency across marketplace and Lowe’s channels.
Position Presti as enabling scalable visual content for marketplace growth.

management_items.title: From DIY Enthusiasts to Pros: Inside Lowe's Marketing Strategies
management_items.summary: Article outlines Lowe’s multichannel marketing: social listening, UGC, omnichannel, AR/VR, digital tools, and a $500M Vision+ initiative through 2025.
key_quotes: "Lowe’s digital transformation is still in progress, but the company is making significant progress."
"Lowe’s Vision+: This is a multi-year initiative to invest in technology and innovation. The company plans to spend $500 million per year through 2025 on these initiatives."

sales_insights: Position Presti visuals as AR/VR-ready content for Vision+ initiatives.
Highlight how Presti can feed omnichannel marketing with consistent imagery.
Suggest Presti as a partner for UGC-style professional visuals.

management_items.title: How Lowe’s Is Investing $50 Million to Build the Next Generation of Tradespeople
management_items.summary: Conway discusses Lowe’s Foundation’s $50M investment to train 50,000 individuals in skilled trades via grants, apprenticeships, and community partnerships.

management_items.title: Lowe's CEO talks about expanding offerings at rural locations

"We have the unique ability to execute both urban and rural… it feels like their hometown store."

management_items.title: La‑Z‑Boy Announces Next‑Gen 3D Product Configuration with WebAR OnDemand™, Powered by 3D Cloud by Marxent
management_items.summary: La‑Z‑Boy launched WebAR OnDemand and next‑gen 3D product configuration to enable shoppers to preview millions of product combinations in AR without an app, boosting digital personalization and bridging online and in‑store experiences.

Our data show that when customers conduct online research they arrive at the store better informed, resulting in a more satisfying buying experience and ultimate product satisfaction.

management_items.title: Williams‑Sonoma CEO explains pricing strategy after earnings beat
management_items.summary: Laura Alber emphasizes upfront, consistent pricing to avoid training customers to wait for promotions, reinforcing pricing integrity and brand trust.
